<NEW - WHEELIE>

There was a sudden pause over from WHEELIE Then as he hear=
d the name 'GRIMLOCK'.  A quiet shaking of his head as hew shipered, as if =
half in fear, ahlf in shock, half in (he's bad at math) surprise and half m=
ourning.  "Grimlock, you say?  With four others..  Dinosaurs if I may?"

Th=
e bit with the 'black large car' and the other 'Maximal' hitting him for a =
few moments as he forced some coolant to pump through his systems and cut b=
ack his emotional subroutines, "For who those two were, I don't know.  But =
I do not know where to go.  If Grimlock is here, why I say..  Would he atta=
ck another in such a way?"

Shaking his head quietly, processing.  Assuming=
 that it meant Grimlock and hte other Dinobots were here on Earth as well, =
even Grimlock in a poor mood would not attack a Maximal with intent to kill=
.  He might beat them some or intimidate, but if what he was being told was=
 true and Grimlock had not held back..

Something was wrong.  Definitely wr=
ong.  Grimlock was too stubborn to be reprogrammed, and the Predacons, like=
 the Decepticons had tended to utilize far more blatant methodologies in re=
programming, at least as he was aware of.  And would hardly had let the Din=
obots randomly wander around the landscape either.  Even in here.  That lef=
t the Unicronians, whom what little nkowledge of their participation in the=
 BEAST WARS he had read of preferred more blatant things as signs of their =
corruption, like heavy upgrades or slave collars..  

So, that left one hid=
eously disquieting thought in WHEELIE that with what limited data he had se=
emed the likeliest bit.

That GRIMLOCK and the DINOBOTS had attacked anothe=
r Maximal brutally and of their own free processor and subroutines.

But if=
 so..

WHY?
